cobblemon.species.gleamur.desc: After dark is when they are most active. Due to the energy stored in their body, which causes their fur to shine, they can be seen high-jumping while appearing to be shooting stars at a distance.
cobblemon.species.pixiechu.name: Pixiechu
cobblemon.species.pixiechu.desc: Known for its radiant appearance, Pixiechu releases its stored electricity and shows off a wonderful display of sparks. At night, their fur glitters and twinkles like the stars.
cobblemon.species.chemecko.name: Chemecko
cobblemon.species.chemecko.desc: There are certain chemicals stored in its tail. When in fear, it drops its tail behind which will later explode to harm or distract its enemies.
cobblemon.species.molozard.name: Molozard
cobblemon.species.molozard.desc: Molozard, despite gaining a more devilish appearance and attitude, aren't insanely aggressive. They love trainers that feed them often. They're said to bring 'misfortune' (via explosions) to those who mistreat them. The chemicals stored in their tails are highly explosive. They can detach and fling the tail bomb at its enemies or drop them behind if being chased. The tail then explodes, causing severe burns on their target.
cobblemon.species.twirpant.name: Twirpant
cobblemon.species.twirpant.desc: Twirpant will train 24/7 and go through some of the harshest physical training ever just to get stronger. Some will even train to the point of fainting. Armies of them train hard to protect its nest from invading Dartibi.
cobblemon.species.kombantis.name: Kombantis
cobblemon.species.kombantis.desc: Kombantis are so well fit they can spare with each other for 72 hours before they are tired. Their striking is known to be faster and stronger than most Fighting-Type Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.barbenin.name: Barbenin
cobblemon.species.barbenin.desc: Barbenin produce a very toxic substance in its mouth that it spits onto their foes, badly poisoning them. The tips of their fins are also very poisonous.
cobblemon.species.scoprikon.name: Scoprikon
cobblemon.species.scoprikon.desc: They spit out very toxic saliva onto its enemies, poisoning or paralyzing them. They dwell in deep waters, waiting for prey to come in contact with its sharp fins.
cobblemon.species.kraklam.name: Kraklam
cobblemon.species.kraklam.desc: Due to this invasive species, Shellder have declined on the islands. They seem to also have a taste for Slowpoke tails. Kraklam hide in the reef or near shores, waiting for prey. In a blink of an eye, their tentacle-like tongues grasp their prey and attack with their horn, releasing a paralyzing toxin.
cobblemon.species.krakshen.name: Krakshen
cobblemon.species.krakshen.desc: These 'sea monsters' lurk deep in the ocean. When starving, they grow vicious and actively hunt for food. Their diet mainly consists of Slowpoke and Cloyster. After feeding enough to last them months, they return to dwell on the ocean floor. Many believe these Pokemon are responsible for swimmers going missing.
cobblemon.species.caraprisma.name: Caraprisma
cobblemon.species.caraprisma.desc: Caraprisma are known for their beautiful shells. But the most valuable shells come from the females, which are rarely seen in the wild as they are afraid of being hunted for its chromatic shell. Caraprisma shells may act like solar panels. They swim near the surface of the ocean absorbing energy from the sun.
cobblemon.species.clawconut.name: Clawconut
cobblemon.species.clawconut.desc: They can be seen building sand castles or climbing up most trees near the beach. Hiding high up on trees, they drop themselves onto their foes' heads hoping to knock them out.
cobblemon.species.clawgigus.name: Clawgigus
cobblemon.species.clawgigus.desc: Clawgigus likes to wait for its pray, blending into a leafy, shady environment with its camouflage. When its target passes by, Clawgigus pounces it and circles it, allowing no room for escape.
cobblemon.species.fribitad.name: Fribitad
cobblemon.species.fribitad.desc: With their vine tail, they swing from branch to branch to traverse through places. Because of their short arms, it uses its tail to grab and pickup items from out of reach.
cobblemon.species.ribivine.name: Ribivine
cobblemon.species.ribivine.desc: It extends the vines on its arms to swing from place to place. It has managed to use its vines to attack its foes.
cobblemon.species.meritrot.name: Meritrot
cobblemon.species.meritrot.desc: Gentle-natured and friendly, Meritrot love being around people and giving rides. They are far stronger than they appear and are used for farm work all over Atlas.
cobblemon.species.stalliot.name: Stalliot
cobblemon.species.stalliot.desc: Despite their gruff, tough looks, Stalliot are trustful Pokemon that allow almost anyone to ride them, making them popular with farmers and Trainers alike.
cobblemon.species.carosella.name: Carosella
cobblemon.species.carosella.desc: A popular Pokemon known for its majestic beauty and horseback riding. Their stubborn attitude makes it difficult for beginning riders and an evolved Meritrot may suddenly regard its Trainer with disdain.
cobblemon.species.hematick.name: Hematick
cobblemon.species.hematick.desc: It feeds on the blood of any big Pokemon it latches onto without them noticing. It will not let go until it's full.
cobblemon.species.vorvosip.name: Vorvosip
cobblemon.species.vorvosip.desc: Vorvosip locates its prey by using its heat-sensing proboscis. Once it locates its prey, it will swoop down towards it in high speeds and paralyze it with a numbing fluid before feeding. Females are more aggressive than males.
cobblemon.species.stegrump.name: Stegrump
cobblemon.species.stegrump.desc: An ancient Pokemon revived from a Sturdy Plate Fossil. Centuries ago, Stegrump were widespread throughout Orohn and grazed wherever there was food to be had. Slow and taciturn, Stegrump travel in large herds, dutifully lumbering and munching on almost everything they pass by.
cobblemon.species.stegovore.name: Stegovore
cobblemon.species.stegovore.desc: Its skin is extremely tough and contains a certain pigment that absorbs sunlight, providing it with energy. Stegovore need to stay at a certain body temperature to be able to use all of its bodily functions correctly, so it always stands with its plates facing the sun to absorb heat. Great herds of Stegovore would trample across prehistoric Orohn, and as recently discovered, these migrations are the cause of much of modern Orohn's flat grasslands.
cobblemon.species.devostoric.name: Devostoric
cobblemon.species.devostoric.desc: In the waters of Prehistoric Orohn-Havai, Devostoric was an apex predator. Due to its heavy plating, it was a slow but powerful swimmer and relied heavily on its strong beaked mouth to capture food. The great force of their jaw is capable of damaging the hardest of metals.
cobblemon.species.petirex.name: Petirex
cobblemon.species.petirex.desc: An ancient Pokemon revived from a Big Tooth Fossil. This Pokemon used to roam the lands in ancient times. Scarcity of food was the reason for its extinction.
cobblemon.species.wreckasaur.name: Wreckasaur
cobblemon.species.wreckasaur.desc: A savage creature whose stomp was said to cause earthquakes. Its jaws were able to smash even the strongest of metals.
cobblemon.species.arrocknid.name: Arrocknid
cobblemon.species.arrocknid.desc: They make their homes in the holes they drill into the cave walls. Since they dwell deep in caves where there is no light, their eyes have adapted very well to allow them to see any movement in the dark. The silently crawl to the roof of the cave to drill out rocks to drop onto its prey.
cobblemon.species.exoroknid.name: Exoroknid
cobblemon.species.exoroknid.desc: Exoroknid dwell deep in caves. Their eyes are very well adapted to the dark which allows them to hunt stealthily. They drill holes to hide in or make traps on the cave floor for prey to fall in.
cobblemon.species.therasloth.name: Therasloth
cobblemon.species.therasloth.desc: Therasloth are awfully lazy, and never lift a finger unless their life is threatened. They can sleep for an upwards of 20 hours. With their tough claws, they hallow out trees to store their food in preparation for scarce winters.
cobblemon.species.slotherror.name: Slotherror
cobblemon.species.slotherror.desc: Colossloth are still as lazy as their unevolved counterpart, but are particularly vicious when awoken. Their claws can tear through boulders like butter.
cobblemon.species.wooble.name: Wooble
cobblemon.species.wooble.desc: Wooble's wool keeps it warm in the harshest arctic climates. People in those areas tend to keep Wooble to use their wool for clothing.
cobblemon.species.snowool.name: Snowool
cobblemon.species.snowool.desc: Snowool are treasured by the trainers who manage to raise them in the harsh climates. The scarf from Snowool is said to warm up anyone, regardless of how cold they were prior.
cobblemon.species.shiveram.name: Shiveram
cobblemon.species.shiveram.desc: When Snowool are desperate for protection in the harsh winter cold, the strongest, most bravest Snowool will evolve into Shiveram. It's capable of tanking insanely powerful blows, and reaching ramming speeds of 25 miles per hour.
cobblemon.species.turtelisk.name: Turtelisk
cobblemon.species.turtelisk.desc: Its sturdy shell is made from iron and won't take a scratch from any attack. With its sharp beak, it can bite through the toughest tree trunks.
cobblemon.species.karaggon.name: Karaggon
cobblemon.species.karaggon.desc: With its powerful limbs it's developed upon evolving, it launches itself like a cannon ball at its foes. Very little can get past their sturdy shells.
cobblemon.species.akrovern.name: Akrovern
cobblemon.species.akrovern.desc: Akrovern are vicious and aggressive towards anyone in their way and are so hard to tame hardly any Trainer has one. Those able to control this powerful beast are often honored and respected for their achievement. During medieval times, Akrovern was known to be one of the most powerful Dragon-type Pokemon in the world, that could destroy an entire kingdom on its own when angered.
cobblemon.species.glozard.name: Glozard
cobblemon.species.glozard.desc: They flash the bio-luminescent spots on their tails and foreheads to communicate. Their head spike lets them detect electrical charges in the area.
cobblemon.species.radizorb.name: Radizorb
cobblemon.species.radizorb.desc: Radizorb's glowing appendages evolved to double as both a battery and a weapon. Its lights can power a 3-story house for weeks at a time before needing to recharge.
cobblemon.species.radiaze.name: Radiaze
cobblemon.species.radiaze.desc: The energy it absorbs from thunderstorms can be concentrated into a powerful beam. It can absorb power from cities to cause a major blackout, though they rarely do this, unless they have been thoroughly wronged by a human trainer.
cobblemon.species.clastroid.name: Clastroid
cobblemon.species.clastroid.desc: Scientists have traced its tracks coming from a planet outside our solar system. The planet is covered in ice and only these Pokemon were found to be inhabiting it.
cobblemon.species.colistroid.name: Colistroid
cobblemon.species.colistroid.desc: Colistroid live in clusters deep inside caves. There are ice gems inside its body which keeps its body at a freezing temperature needed to live.
cobblemon.species.galixoid.name: Galixoid
cobblemon.species.galixoid.desc: A strange rock formation said to have migrated from a frozen planet, where they once guarded an ancient fortress. It is unknown who or what they were guarding, but it is assumed to be a powerful force. It's sturdy features suggests it is built to keep intruders from entering the fortress.
cobblemon.species.fortibal.name: Fortibal
cobblemon.species.fortibal.desc: Fortibal can use both defense and offense at the same time by rolling up in a spiked ball and charging at its enemies.
cobblemon.species.armodieval.name: Armodieval
cobblemon.species.armodieval.desc: Known also in the medieval times of the Pokemon world, Armodieval would protect and stand guard in a castle with its ultimate defense. Its unbreakable shield is made of solid titanium and can stop even the most powerful blast.
cobblemon.species.pinxie.name: Pinxie
cobblemon.species.pinxie.desc: Scientists believe they were formed from the cosmic dust after a star dies. Why or how they ended up in Orohn-Havai is still a mystery.
cobblemon.species.cosminx.name: Cosminx
cobblemon.species.cosminx.desc: Scientists are unable to trace its origins but it is believed they migrated from a space cloud in deep space. It is said the gas emitting from its body has healing powers and purifies the air.
cobblemon.species.sharfin.name: Sharfin
cobblemon.species.sharfin.desc: Sharfin are known to sink small boats by slicing holes in them with its extremely sharp fin.
cobblemon.species.thrashark.name: Thrashark
cobblemon.species.thrashark.desc: The fins of Thrashark can easily cut through rocks and boats. They like to dwell in the dark then make a surprise attack to the boats on the surface, sinking them.
cobblemon.species.abyssoul.name: Abyssoul
cobblemon.species.abyssoul.desc: Folklore says its orb that it carries contains the spirits of humans who lost their lives at sea. The orb helps guide itself in the deep sea as well as attract prey.
cobblemon.species.voidevour.name: Voidevour
cobblemon.species.voidevour.desc: Typically scouring the depths of the ocean, Voidevour lure in it's prey with it's eerie bulb, quickly snapping it's boney jaws around it's meal when they get too close.
cobblemon.species.ruffski.name: Ruffski
cobblemon.species.ruffski.desc: Because they are only found in northern areas, they like to play and run around all day to keep their body heat at a suitable temperature.
cobblemon.species.arblizen.name: Arblizen
cobblemon.species.arblizen.desc: They work together in a pack to hunt down prey. As food goes scarce and tension rises, packs of Arblizen will form rivalries with other packs.
cobblemon.species.siberizen.name: Siberizen
cobblemon.species.siberizen.desc: Known as the judge of the north, Siberizen is a powerful yet wise Pokemon. It chooses the fate of those found within its territory by its underlings.
cobblemon.species.pipsicle.name: Pipsicle
cobblemon.species.pipsicle.desc: Their bodies are made up of a similar substance to Never-Melt Ice. They can withstand harsh temperatures. Their cold bodies help cool the air around themselves, and for that, they are commonly used indoors for those who don't have air conditioning. However, people are warned not to be exposed to them for long periods of time due to fears of getting frostbite.
cobblemon.species.wilspri.name: Wilspri
cobblemon.species.wilspri.desc: Rumor has it that Wilspri are children who became trapped after they wandered or were lured deep into the forest and never returned. In dark woods one can occasionally hear a child's weeping, which is said to be the sound of an angered Wilspri.
cobblemon.species.trillowee.name: Trillowee
cobblemon.species.trillowee.desc: It became more wicked upon evolution. There have been rare cases of Trillowee kidnapping wandering children. It is said to imitate the sound of a crying child to lure strangers into the forest. Trillowee will then swoop in and steal their soul.
cobblemon.species.tasticky.name: Tasticky
cobblemon.species.tadapt.name: Tadapt
cobblemon.species.tadapt.desc: Tadapt's cell structure quickly configures itself to easily adapt to its surroundings. This allows it so they can withstand any harsh climate effects.
cobblemon.species.thornment.name: Thornment
cobblemon.species.thornment.desc: It conceals itself within foliage. Its thorny tail is used to wrap around any prey that comes into touch with it, hurting it and dragging it around until it loses consciousness.
cobblemon.species.phrilter.name: Phrilter
cobblemon.species.phrilter.desc: Residing near volcanic areas, it opens its frills to radiate extreme heat from the stored lava it consumes. A group of Phrilter are known to cause heatwaves.
cobblemon.species.vortexol.name: Vortexol
cobblemon.species.vortexol.desc: It propels at extreme speeds by rotating the blades on its tail. It creates whirlpools to trap its foes.
cobblemon.species.elecko.name: Elecko
cobblemon.species.elecko.desc: Commonly found in urban cities, it runs across wires to gather electricity and charge itself. Contact with a supercharged Elecko will send electric shocks throughout your body.
cobblemon.species.foxsye.name: Foxsye
cobblemon.species.foxsye.desc: The mystical orb it holds possesses a magical power that allows them to see through deception and trickery. It seeks out for the truth. Eye contact with a Foxsye will urge you to spill your secrets.
cobblemon.species.veroxifye.name: Veroxifye
cobblemon.species.veroxifye.desc: Veroxifye's orb is referred to as its 'Third Eye' due to its ability to reveal the truth as well as deception. They will fight to protect their group from Zoroark, their bitter enemies. It is thought this feud began with a vision shown in a Veroxifye's orb.
cobblemon.species.tundrill.name: Tundrill
cobblemon.species.tundrill.desc: A major hazard for roads and urban areas in general. Twisting its body in a drilling motion, it can submerge into the ground in mere seconds. Attracted to noise, they quickly drill their way to the source. They also will set traps for prey to fall in.
cobblemon.species.camohut.name: Camohut
cobblemon.species.camohut.desc: Their disguise as tiny huts helps prevent them from getting in danger with predators. They move in herds traveling around near the foot of mountains. Their tough exterior withstands powerful attacks and harsh weather conditions.
cobblemon.species.camofirma.name: Camofirma
cobblemon.species.camofirma.desc: Camofirma's large body is sturdy and tough, able to withstand many blows while in the midst of battle. Be it during a terrible blizzard or a blistering sandstorm, the hut on Camofirma's back provides the utmost comfort.
cobblemon.species.fyglow.name: Fyglow
cobblemon.species.fyglow.desc: During moonless nights, groups of Fyglow gather around lakes, gracefully flying in pairs to create majestic light displays.
cobblemon.species.alpheon.name: Alpheon
cobblemon.species.alpheon.desc: - TackleSTAB Normal - Tail Whip Normal - Helping Hand Normal 5 Sand Attack Ground 9 Fake OutSTAB Normal 13 Quick AttackSTAB Normal 17 HeadbuttSTAB Normal 20 Bite Dark 25 Focus Energy Normal 29 RetaliateSTAB Normal 33 Roar Normal 37 Crunch Dark 41 Last ResortSTAB Normal 45 Double-EdgeSTAB Normal
cobblemon.species.eveon.name: Eveon
cobblemon.species.eveon.desc: - TackleSTAB Normal - Tail Whip Normal - Helping Hand Normal 5 Sand Attack Ground 9 Heal Pulse Psychic 13 Quick AttackSTAB Normal 17 RoundSTAB Normal 20 Wish Normal 25 Attract Normal 29 Captivate Normal 33 Calm Mind Psychic 37 Hyper VoiceSTAB Normal 41 Last ResortSTAB Normal 45 Healing Wish Psychic
cobblemon.species.finray.name: Finray
cobblemon.species.finray.desc: It swims against strong currents by skillfully using its tail as a rudder. Its acute hearing allows it to evade any danger.
cobblemon.species.ogoprowl.name: Ogoprowl
cobblemon.species.ogoprowl.desc: They are known to dwell deep in underwater caves. Their glowing red eyes can pierce through the darkest areas.
cobblemon.species.sephysar.name: Sephysar
cobblemon.species.sephysar.desc: Sephysar are known to inhabit the mysterious Lake Altus. There goes a saying that whoever dares cross its territory will face great danger. It's able to harness the power of storms.
cobblemon.species.rivulcred.name: Rivulcred
cobblemon.species.rivulcred.desc: It is known to be a guardian to a sacred river in the Orohn Division. It kept the waters clean and pure. When it disappeared the river became polluted which killed all the plants and made the Pokemon sick.
cobblemon.species.valecred.name: Valecred
cobblemon.species.valecred.desc: It is known to be a guardian to a sacred valley in the Orohn Division. It kept the land rich and healthy. When it disappeared the vegetation began dying and the Pokemon fled the valley.
cobblemon.species.netherval.name: Netherval
cobblemon.species.netherval.desc: It caused the largest volcano eruption on the islands, destroying everything. People say it did this to cleanse the islands of impurities. It erupted for over 2000 years. It went into a deep slumber deep inside the volcano. Ozoridrey and Vernirox took over to protect the islands.
cobblemon.species.quadrossal.name: Quadrossal
cobblemon.species.quadrossal.desc: A legendary Pokemon that came from the depths of the abyss. Folklore says it once flooded the islands to cleanse it of impurities. It went to slumber deep in the icy depths of the region.
cobblemon.species.infiluv.name: Infiluv
cobblemon.species.infiluv.desc: It is said that the couple touched by the tips of its two tails will share eternal love. Its powers are maximized during a certain day of the year.
cobblemon.species.zedakazm.name: Zedakazm
cobblemon.species.zedakazm.desc: The Realm of Zedakazm is the abode of the dead in which this beast is known as Ruler of the Underworld. It is known to bring evil souls to this bottomless realm where they will be tormented for eternity. Legend states that Yveltal is its emissary. Arceus has imprisoned Zedakazm deep within its realm.
cobblemon.species.smettle.name: Smettle
cobblemon.species.smettle.desc: Smettle is a mischievous Pokemon. It likes to use its quills to make fun of other Pokemon, which doesn't attract it friends.
cobblemon.species.smyucca.name: Smyucca
cobblemon.species.smyucca.desc: Smyucca has a very aggressive temperament. It is strongly forbidden to rub against its sharp spines.
cobblemon.species.demonagave.name: Demonagave
cobblemon.species.demonagave.desc: Demonagave's body is entirely covered by spines. Its Needle Arm is often fatal.
cobblemon.species.pachyball.name: Pachyball
cobblemon.species.pachyball.desc: When Pachyball sneezes, sprays of magma come out of its trunk, burning everything in their path. Before falling asleep, it rolls itself into a ball to keep its body warm, which earned it its name.
cobblemon.species.pachyndou.name: Pachyndou
cobblemon.species.pachyndou.desc: Pachyndou's psychic powers and bright colors are an excellent protection against potential predators. When it feels threatened, smoke comes out of the hole on its head.
cobblemon.species.pachyvory.name: Pachyvory
cobblemon.species.pachyvory.desc: Pachyvory's tusks are very resistant. When they become too big, it melts the end with its fiery breath.
cobblemon.species.squini.name: Squini
cobblemon.species.squini.desc: The harpoon-shaped cap on Squini's head can be illuminated so that it is not lost from sight by its fellows. It emits less and less light as it gets ready to evolve.
cobblemon.species.squinja.name: Squinja
cobblemon.species.squinja.desc: Squinja is a fast and accurate fighter. It generally prefers to keep its enemies at a distance, but is quite capable of close combat.
cobblemon.species.squartial.name: Squartial
cobblemon.species.squartial.desc: Squartial never takes rash risks. Each of its moves is well thought out. Contrary to its pre-evolutions, it is relatively solitary.
cobblemon.species.wormini.name: Wormini
cobblemon.species.wormini.desc: Wormini spends its time digging in the ground and rarely sees the light of day.
cobblemon.species.wormeel.name: Wormeel
cobblemon.species.wormeel.desc: Wormini spends its time digging in the ground and rarely sees the light of day.
cobblemon.species.malarva.name: Malarva
cobblemon.species.malarva.desc: Malarva is a parasite that likes to settle on large Pokemon to feed on their blood. It is said that the first strains of the Pokerus were found on this Pokemon and that it is the cause of its propagation.
cobblemon.species.mosdeng.name: Mosdeng
cobblemon.species.mosdeng.desc: Mosdeng lives in wetlands and attacks in packs, which makes it more dangerous. However, it remains very vulnerable to Swellow which make it one of their favorite meals.
cobblemon.species.mosboom.name: Mosboom
cobblemon.species.mosboom.desc: Mosboom is able to explode in the face of predators to protect its offspring as soon as the need arises. When it stings its preys, it inoculates a very powerful poison capable of making a Ursaring fall in 5 seconds.
cobblemon.species.antager.name: Antager
cobblemon.species.antager.desc: Antager is small but don't be fooled by appearances, it can lift up to 50 times its weight.
cobblemon.species.antoldier.name: Antoldier
cobblemon.species.antoldier.desc: Antoldier have an extraordinary power, they can lift a Snorlax without any efforts. They are used in mines to help humans.
cobblemon.species.hamerry.name: Hamerry
cobblemon.species.hamerry.desc: Hamerry is a very popular Pokemon among children. Its cheeks give off a sweet smell, and give it a very friendly look.
cobblemon.species.hamysos.name: Hamysos
cobblemon.species.hamysos.desc: Hamysos is a festive Pokemon. It is said that its cheeks are actually large Ceriz berries, and that tasting them causes a euphoric state.
cobblemon.species.goatanaa.name: Goatanaa
cobblemon.species.goatanaa.desc: Goatanaa lives in the mountains. It moves according to the weather, when it is hot, it seeks the coolness in the heights and when the winter arrives, it goes down in the valleys.
cobblemon.species.goaturly.name: Goaturly
cobblemon.species.goaturly.desc: Goaturly is bred for its precious wool, which is both soft and resistant. It is used to make rich clothes. It is in perpetual conflict with Frison because of their ego.
cobblemon.species.pomara.name: Pomara
cobblemon.species.pomara.desc: Pomara live near lakes and rivers. They like to gather to parade at the water's edge.
cobblemon.species.dashean.name: Dashean
cobblemon.species.dashean.desc: Dashean is a sea horse. It is able to gallop on the water at impressive speeds.
cobblemon.species.boonny.name: Boonny
cobblemon.species.boonny.desc: Boonny's body is essentially made of meteorite, which does not prevent it from jumping extremely high.
cobblemon.species.rabball.name: Rabball
cobblemon.species.rabball.desc: After evolution, this Pokemon is enclosed in a meteoric shell. It is able to resist the trampling of a horde of Tauros.
cobblemon.species.lagorite.name: Lagorite
cobblemon.species.lagorite.desc: Lagorite uses its arms as both a shield and a sharp blade. A Meteor Mash from this Pokemon knocks out a Rhydon
cobblemon.species.gnatle.name: Gnatle
cobblemon.species.gnatle.desc: Gnatle are incredibly hard to notice, making them highly sought after among collectors. When facing down they look like any kind of rock found in the woods. When happy, they scatter and jump around cheerfully.
cobblemon.species.growel.name: Growel
cobblemon.species.growel.desc: Growel are incredibly rare in the wild in relation to its pre evolved form. Considered ancient warriors of the great forests of Norheim, Growel practices stealth tactics like no other Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.huskerous.name: Huskerous
cobblemon.species.huskerous.desc: Evo Horn LeechSTAB Grass 55 Head SmashSTAB Rock 68 Megahorn Bug
cobblemon.species.pouffy.name: Pouffy
cobblemon.species.pouffy.desc: There's no bad weather, only poor coats of feathers. When practicing the skill of flight, Pouffy launches itself out of steep cliffs and before doing so this Pokemon waits patiently in line for its turn.
cobblemon.species.puffard.name: Puffard
cobblemon.species.puffard.desc: Puffard, a brave storm chaser. Risking getting hit by lightning won't stop it from flying into the dark clouds of the ocean skies.
cobblemon.species.pelasquall.name: Pelasquall
cobblemon.species.pelasquall.desc: Experts of strong winds and raging waves. This rare species of flying Pokemon has been seen rescuing both people and Pokemon lost at sea. Only the most skillful Pelasquall can channel lighting strikes through its long head feather; and resist the power of dark clouds.
cobblemon.species.buppie.name: Buppie
cobblemon.species.buppie.desc: A trainer's best friend. Buppie enjoys playing in shallow pools of water while barking to the sound of thunder.
cobblemon.species.bubawl.name: Bubawl
cobblemon.species.bubawl.desc: Bubawl cries large pools of water when scared and is terrified of the thunder. Its tongue has magical properties and will heal any wound.
cobblemon.species.brinarder.name: Brinarder
cobblemon.species.brinarder.desc: A trainer's best friend; if you are bold enough. By chasing its wavy tail on the water surface, Brinarder creates waterspouts. It is said that looking directly into its eyes will scare about anyone off.
cobblemon.species.larver.name: Larver
cobblemon.species.strikoon.name: Strikoon
cobblemon.species.battlefly.name: Battlefly
cobblemon.species.mothight.name: Mothight
cobblemon.species.rowdent.name: Rowdent
cobblemon.species.lemini.name: Lemini
cobblemon.species.lemini.desc: When frightened, Lemini escapes danger by jumping off cliffs in search for safety. Its round and soft body guarantees a safe landing.
cobblemon.species.gnimmel.name: Gnimmel
cobblemon.species.gnimmel.desc: Gnimmel are great lookouts for potential danger. They guard their burrowed nests with care to provide safety for Lemini.
cobblemon.species.wolverage.name: Wolverage
cobblemon.species.wolverage.desc: A rare sight to behold in the forests of Migard; often mistaken for other Pokemon. When hungry, it may tear down large trees with its clumsy body.
cobblemon.species.shrumin.name: Shrumin
cobblemon.species.shrumin.desc: Shrumin are elusive and whimsical creatures. They hide deep within magical forests. They may occasionly camouflage themselves with leaves.
cobblemon.species.ignikid.name: Ignikid
cobblemon.species.ignikid.desc: Ignikid has learned from a young age that playing with fire can be dangerous. They may however burn things out of curiosity.
cobblemon.species.furyture.name: Furyture
cobblemon.species.furyture.desc: Notorious for breaking the spell of young love. Furyture gathers the anger from couples trying to piece together cheap furniture parts.
cobblemon.species.speyeder.name: Speyeder
cobblemon.species.birdler.name: Birdler
cobblemon.species.birdler.desc: When Tweetler wags its tail feathers, it gives off a signal that the coast is clear. This Pokemon is obsessed with shiny objects; it will go far in order to retrieve what it is looking for.
cobblemon.species.magpyja.name: Magpyja
cobblemon.species.magpyja.desc: Magpyja works as mob bosses over groups of Tweetler and are obsessed with shiny objects. They are merciless and may use their talons to attack children in the woods while screeching in human tongue.
cobblemon.species.bomblebee.name: Bomblebee
cobblemon.species.bomblebee.desc: With a body that's both big and heavy in relation to its wing size, Bomblebee is forced to primarily use the power of magnetism in order to stay afloat. This bug Pokemon will not hestitate to blow any intruder up.
cobblemon.species.draftbee.name: Draftbee
cobblemon.species.draftbee.desc: Loyal to their queen, Draftbee works in great numbers to protect their hive. When gathered in large quantities, their body temperature may rise and burn their foe. They used to be enemies of Beedrill; until they were driven to extinction in all of Norheim.
cobblemon.species.wispear.name: Wispear
cobblemon.species.wispear.desc: Wispear are spirits of young children who got lost after dark and never returned home. They may whisper in the ears of travelers, telling them which way to go and return to safety. They may play tricks however, making both people and Pokemon to walk astray into the unknown wilderness.
cobblemon.species.roomere.name: Roomere
cobblemon.species.roomere.desc: Roomere may appear inside local buildings next to roads, spreading rumors. Some say that these ghosts used to work as innkeeper ladies and were the victims of terrible house fires.
cobblemon.species.bunnler.name: Bunnler
cobblemon.species.bunnler.desc: Using heavy snowfall as cover for the perfect heist. Bunnler is an expert of stealth for its own benefit; to steal from other Pokemon, storing items in its tail; and to hide away from Snowl.
cobblemon.species.spinache.name: Spinache
cobblemon.species.spinache.desc: Spinache spins around at all times, preventing it from getting attacked by Moler, leaving it with constant nausea. While spinning, this Pokemon ruins crops and turns farmland into a complete mess.
cobblemon.species.beatroot.name: Beatroot
cobblemon.species.beatroot.desc: An unwanted guest among farmers. Beatroot turns the soil red when angered, destroying crops in its rage. Beatroot's hands and the stem on its head has been cut off by its primary enemy, Moleheimer.
cobblemon.species.moler.name: Moler
cobblemon.species.moleheimer.name: Moleheimer
cobblemon.species.moleheimer.desc: Moleheimer is the greatest navigator in all of Norheim. Its swirl like scars are the remains of countless battles with Beatroot.
cobblemon.species.tadit.name: Tadit
cobblemon.species.tadit.desc: Tadit may overpopulate during summer. Whenever that happens, they may get stuck in shallow pools of water, struggling for room among other Tadits. Only its parent, Ribhit, can save its young by carrying them on its back to bigger pools of water.
cobblemon.species.ribhit.name: Ribhit
cobblemon.species.firipeck.name: Firipeck
cobblemon.species.firipeck.desc: Quick to flee. Firipeck are picky when choosing a tree to peck. When hurled up they are often mistaken for Poke Balls.
cobblemon.species.fyrepecker.name: Fyrepecker
cobblemon.species.shrisker.name: Shrisker
cobblemon.species.swirrell.name: Swirrell
cobblemon.species.swirrell.desc: Swirrell thrives in forest fires. Hollow and burnt out logs and trees makes a suitable home to raise a family in. They are swift to escape, leaving smoke clouds behind them
cobblemon.species.meerii.name: Meerii
cobblemon.species.meerii.desc: Meerii are cheerful Pokemon, playing around in rocky riverbeds. Their agile movements is an advantage while hunting along with their electric powers, stunning weaker freshwater Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.tourtell.name: Tourtell
cobblemon.species.tourtell.desc: Tourtell has a peaceful and relaxed nature. Pokemon usually gather on their back to travel across lakes and ponds. History is written on their sturdy bodies.
cobblemon.species.aquatick.name: Aquatick
cobblemon.species.clagcoon.name: Clagcoon
cobblemon.species.yggdraflygg.name: Yggdraflygg
cobblemon.species.yggdraflygg.desc: Yggdraflygg are able to drain out the life force of entire forests. On occasion they pick up cattle from the ground; only to drop them from terrifying heights.
cobblemon.species.grublin.name: Grublin
cobblemon.species.wyrmlagar.name: Wyrmlagar
cobblemon.species.wyrmlagar.desc: Wyrmlagar can grow tremendously in size. Its shadow appears the same as a Gyarados. Legends tell of this Pokemon, corrupting entire lakes.
cobblemon.species.pumfin.name: Pumfin
cobblemon.species.toxing.name: Toxing
cobblemon.species.toxing.desc: Toxing works in great numbers but the spikes of a single one is enough to spread lethal doses of poison. Its meat is edible however.
cobblemon.species.toxiver.name: Toxiver
cobblemon.species.toxiver.desc: Toxiver are ruthless and groups of them can contaminate entire stretches of water. One's spikes can kill a grown man.
cobblemon.species.antle.name: Antle
cobblemon.species.magnificant.name: Magnificant
cobblemon.species.corvhugen.name: Corvhugen
cobblemon.species.corvhugen.desc: Unlike Corviknight, Corvhugen has a padded knight's armor covering most of its body. This offers it more speed for agile combat; battles that don't last very long.
cobblemon.species.vaiking.name: Vaiking
cobblemon.species.vaiking.desc: When a leader Falinks leaves the group, it may evolve into a Vaiking. They have excellent combat skills with both spear and shield.
cobblemon.species.fulion.name: Fulion
cobblemon.species.lopiliar.name: Lopiliar
cobblemon.species.rokstone.name: Rokstone
cobblemon.species.rokstone.desc: Legends tell that a Rokstone can predict cataclysmic events, written in fire, written in stone.
cobblemon.species.witherscence.name: Witherscence
cobblemon.species.slickle.name: Slickle
cobblemon.species.slickle.desc: When frightened, Slickle looses its tail. Over time, the tail will grow back. However, it will become fragile during the recovery process; risking experiencing hypothermia.
cobblemon.species.stricklisk.name: Stricklisk
cobblemon.species.waugur.name: Waugur
cobblemon.species.waugur.desc: They crawl and limb in the many dungeons and ruins throughout Norheim. The horns on a Waugur's head are the remains of the helmets they wore during war, fused with their skull as a reminder of horrible battles.
cobblemon.species.dragamant.name: Dragamant
cobblemon.species.snhail.name: Snhail
cobblemon.species.snhail.desc: Curious yet easily frightened. Approaching its -248 fahrenheit icicle covered shell will instantly freeze any foe.
cobblemon.species.cariboo.name: Cariboo
cobblemon.species.spectrelk.name: Spectrelk
cobblemon.species.spectrelk.desc: Spectrelk is a rare sight to behold and it is the cause of foggy and gloomy weather. While bellowing and rutting, it calls for the morning mist. The foggy weather protects the corners of Norheim’s primal forests and greets the passing of Pokemon to join the spirit world.
cobblemon.species.streuming.name: Streuming
cobblemon.species.streuming.desc: The Gold Stream that brings warmth to Norheim and its surrounding islands are powered up by millions of Streuming. Agile and determined they swim, elegantly.
cobblemon.species.basshark.name: Basshark
cobblemon.species.basshark.desc: Basshark provides strong currents to the Ore Sea, creating whats known as the Gold Stream. It can launch other Pokemon with its powered tuck mouth; that also captures large quantities of Sardiner in the process.
cobblemon.species.mannbrann.name: Mannbrann
cobblemon.species.mannbrann.desc: Mannbrann viciously lashes onto its prey with its four tentacles, giving off a burning sensation. Some may adapt to become immune to water.
cobblemon.species.sardiner.name: Sardiner
cobblemon.species.sardiner.desc: The stench of a Muk may seem like a gag in comparison to a school of Sardiner. Despite how stinky they are, they make up the majority of a Basshark's diet.
cobblemon.species.charctic.name: Charctic
cobblemon.species.charctic.desc: Charctic has adapted by living in such a cold climate, warming itself up. Its fiery temper is shown through its thrashing and biting moves.
cobblemon.species.pengwin.name: Pengwin
cobblemon.species.pengwin.desc: Slalom, Downhill racing, Slopestyle; Pengwin knows them all.
cobblemon.species.charryon.name: Charryon
cobblemon.species.charryon.desc: Charryon can only feel sorrow. It leaves safe passage to the afterlife for both Pokemon and humans.
cobblemon.species.crudecay.name: Crudecay
cobblemon.species.crudecay.desc: Burrowed inside the body of an unknown water dwelling Pokemon. Crudecay (Cloaked form) lurks during nighttime on dark shores, waiting to feed on innocent pray. It reeks of death.
cobblemon.species.hingjaw.name: Hingjaw
cobblemon.species.hingjaw.desc: Hingjaw is a member of the Shellder and the Cloyster family. While its insides are soft and fragile and served as a delicacy in Norheim, its exterior shell is incredibly hard and tough. This Pokemon has a tendency to bite onto anything that approaches it.
cobblemon.species.saberian.name: Saberian
cobblemon.species.saberian.desc: Despite its size and bulky stature, a Saberian can reach a top speed at around 30 mph, sometimes higher if desired. They were the apex predators during the age of the Great Snowfall.
cobblemon.species.wreggog.name: Wreggog
cobblemon.species.wreggog.desc: Hatched from an incredibly hard egg, using the egg shell as armor. The petrified leaf on its nose is both hard and sharp, excellent for physical combat.
cobblemon.species.terrahorn.name: Terrahorn
cobblemon.species.terrahorn.desc: The massive lungs of this relic can produce an incredible amount of air, bursting out of its hollow horn, the stumps on its back and its nostrils. The horn itself along the stumps on its back may break over time as they clash into other Terrahorn, fighting over territory.
cobblemon.species.dunesparr.name: Dunesparr
cobblemon.species.dunesparr.desc: Exotic Pokemon such as Dunsparce were once brought to the Island of Norheim by traders and seafarers. They were quick to escape however, burrowing themselves into the sandy shores. Over time they became a new species, Dunesparr; a nastier version of Dunsparce.
cobblemon.species.deviburn.name: Deviburn
cobblemon.species.deviburn.desc: Deviburn travels the inside of houses during the night, going through the chimney. On its way in it gathers charcoal to boost the fire power it possesses. Any presents placed by Delibird are burnt to cinder which may also lead to a house fire.
cobblemon.species.valbear.name: Valbear
cobblemon.species.anenome.name: Anenome
cobblemon.species.anenome.desc: Present but not seen. Anenome has the ability to turn completely invisible. It may appear during dark winter nights; only to taste the food offered by farmers.
cobblemon.species.trollskgur.name: Trollskógur
cobblemon.species.trollskgur.desc: Trollskógur rules the forests of Migard. They can change their appearance into humans and are extremely greedy.
cobblemon.species.crimgon.name: Crimgon
cobblemon.species.crimgon.desc: Crimgon is capable of retracting its limbs inside its shell. Inside the shell, it builds up anger, ready to attack with its spiky head. The limbs themselves are soft, unlike the shell.
cobblemon.species.reavler.name: Reavler
cobblemon.species.reavler.desc: Reavler travels with the Northern Wind yet it can't stand the cold. Its scythe like limbs can cut through diamonds, even from a distance.
cobblemon.species.safian.name: Safian
cobblemon.species.spelewink.name: Spelewink
cobblemon.species.spelewink.desc: Strange fluids can be collected from Spelewink's skin, making what seems to be love potions. These said love potions can be lethal however, according to witnesses from a number of victims.
cobblemon.species.wulca.name: Wulca
cobblemon.species.wulcrush.name: Wulcrush
cobblemon.species.wulcrush.desc: Wulcrush hunts in packs on both shores and in the ocean. They lure their prey by strategically cornering it; while also seeing it as a game.
cobblemon.species.conduvan.name: Conduvan
cobblemon.species.conduvan.desc: Conduvan (UB Cluster) was first seen on the night skies of the Northern Hemisphere. A parent of multiple star clusters and a bringer of eggs; this outlandish Pokemon may occasionally sacrifice bad eggs.
cobblemon.species.wellmr.name: Wellmr
cobblemon.species.wellmr.desc: Wellmír (UB Well) is located under the tree of Silyggdra. It's said to make any wish come true, unless you stumble across its destructive powers.
cobblemon.species.gazhel.name: Gazhel
cobblemon.species.gazhel.desc: Gazhel (UB Entity) is an alarmingly grotesque Ultra Beast. It collects souls from different dimensions only to bring them back to its own realm.
cobblemon.species.dracruel.name: Dracruel
cobblemon.species.auumbull.name: Auðumbull
cobblemon.species.auumbull.desc: Legends speak of a bull whom corrupted the spirit of a cow. Auðumbull uses its tongue, licking the nutrients from both rock and ice; granting the power of gods only for itself.
cobblemon.species.spiritnir.name: Spiritnir
cobblemon.species.spiritnir.desc: The grey steed of a God. Spiritnir can move its legs so fast that they appear as eight instead of four. It has been seen galloping faster than the wind on both land and on the surface of the sea.
cobblemon.species.valcurie.name: Valcurie
cobblemon.species.valcurie.desc: The queen of six former heroines and the last of her kind. Valcurie decides the fate of Pokemon; who may die with glory or to live to finish their story.
cobblemon.species.steinfjorir.name: Steinfjorir
cobblemon.species.steinfjorir.desc: Steinfjorir usually attacks from below, raising sharp rocks to trap its foes. The rugged coasts and fjords surrounding and entering Norheim has been shaped by this bird Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.fifii.name: Fifii
cobblemon.species.fifii.desc: The spirit of a solitary but joyful girl. Fifii brings happiness among both children and Pokemon. She is incredibly strong and can carry a Sleepnir with her braid-like arms.
cobblemon.species.emii.name: Emii
cobblemon.species.emii.desc: The spirit of an enraged, prankish boy. Emii's canon like arms can blast through even the densest of all objects.
cobblemon.species.grimapa.name: Grimapa
cobblemon.species.grimapa.desc: The defiler of the marshes and the Destroyer of the Hall of Heroes. Once Grimapa has contaminated the entire Old Growth of a foreign land, it will prey on Deiteress's weakened soul.
cobblemon.species.hoglog.name: Hoglog
cobblemon.species.deiteress.name: Deiteress
cobblemon.species.deiteress.desc: - Sweet Scent Normal - Tackle Normal 5 Aromatic Mist Fairy 10 Disarming VoiceSTAB Fairy 15 Nature Power Normal 20 Stomp Normal 25 Aromatherapy Grass 30 Growth Normal 35 Magical LeafSTAB Grass 40 Flower Shield Fairy 45 Floral Healing Fairy 50 Take Down Normal 55 Petal BlizzardSTAB Grass 60 MoonblastSTAB Fairy 65 Heal Pulse Psychic 70 Petal DanceSTAB Grass 75 Play RoughSTAB Fairy 80 Grassy Terrain Grass 85 Last Resort Normal
cobblemon.species.hamarrcal.name: Hamarrcal
cobblemon.species.hamarrcal.desc: Once worshipped by agricultural people for centuries in hope of rain and a successful harvest. Little did they know however how this Pokemon once drained multiple seas; creating stormy, cosmic clouds. Hamarrcal's precison when striking is out of this world.
cobblemon.species.wyrmundel.name: Wyrmundel
cobblemon.species.wyrmundel.desc: The Connector of Worlds and the Serpent of the Ore Sea. After an epic clash with Hamarrcal, Wyrmundel nearly swallowed an entire region and its surrounding waters; a time when heroes were at stake.
cobblemon.species.wulfang.name: Wulfang
cobblemon.species.wulfang.desc: The twin of the Serpent with eyes full of primal hate, Wyrmundel. Wulfang dwells from the coast of the Ore Sea to the center of Migard only to cause terror to poor souls.
cobblemon.species.squisker.name: Squisker
cobblemon.species.squisker.desc: Squisker delivers messages of genetic code to categorize and file the knowledge of each Pokemon; running up and down a giant tree. The drill like horn on top of its head works as a multi-purpose tool, drilling holes in both trees and the ground.
cobblemon.species.arovee.name: Arovee
cobblemon.species.arovee.desc: An artificial Pokémon built to assist in exploration. It's easily configurable to fit different situations. If its operator runs into danger, it will transport them to a safe area.
cobblemon.species.eyesi.name: Eyesi
cobblemon.species.eyesi.desc: During the day, they blend in among the trees they nest in. At night, however, their big eyes open and they become active, hunting for prey with their unparalleled night vision.
cobblemon.species.eyesaur.name: Eyesaur
cobblemon.species.eyesaur.desc: Eyesaur's eyes are always moving in different directions from each other, as they are sensitive to movement. Legends say that if you lock eyes with it, you turn to stone.
cobblemon.species.shaelseum.name: Shaelseum
cobblemon.species.clawryde.name: Clawryde
cobblemon.species.clawryde.desc: Once mistaken for a plant, the wooden 'body' is just a piece of flotsam it's attached itself to. It inflicts fierce, whip-like lashes with its fronded heads.
cobblemon.species.snipion.name: Snipion
cobblemon.species.snipion.desc: In ancient seas, it held its prey down with its claws and stabbed them with its heavy tail. When this tail is reared up, it warns potential predators to stay away.
cobblemon.species.chainscraw.name: Chainscraw
cobblemon.species.chainscraw.desc: It was part of a now-extinct lineage of Bug Pokemon relatives. The undersides of its claws spin and vibrate at such rates that it is easily able to grind through stone.
cobblemon.species.wicruet.name: Wicruet
cobblemon.species.wicruet.desc: A very persistent Mon, Wicruet can gather a following like no other. Its vessel contains water, which is thought to symbolise the sweat and tears it pours into attaining evolution. Legends state that a holy man once visited Tonbury Town with a Wicruet.
cobblemon.species.eucharite.name: Eucharite
cobblemon.species.eucharite.desc: Upon evolution the water in its vessel has turned into a sweet red wine, which Eucharite shares freely with its following, never seeming to deplete no matter the numbers.
cobblemon.species.herburrow.name: Herburrow
cobblemon.species.herburrow.desc: Often found buried in soil, sleeping Herburrow's leaves have become a source of macronutrients for local Stug populations. Fortunately these curious creatures grow extremely quickly, making them very popular with students of herbalism.
cobblemon.species.professherb.name: Professherb
cobblemon.species.professherb.desc: Professherb love nothing more than to bestow their wisdom to humans, sometimes tearing their own leaves out to demonstrate the remedial properties. These leaves will grown back within 24 hours.
cobblemon.species.yoink.name: Yoink
cobblemon.species.yoink.desc: Yoink hide in orchards, patiently waiting for farmers to take their eyes off the trees. When they do, Yoink steal as much fruit as they can hold, before hightailing it back to their dens.
cobblemon.species.hogrump.name: Hogrump
cobblemon.species.hogrump.desc: Now much larger and belligerent in nature, it's impossible for Hogrump to steal fruit without getting caught by farmers. As a result, they bully and steal instead from weaker Yoink.
cobblemon.species.dorhouse.name: Dorhouse
cobblemon.species.dorhouse.desc: Dorhouse carry around a hollowed wooden stump, which at night they climb inside and sleep. Locals know not to disturb the stumps should they find one, instead leaving fruit offerings outside.
cobblemon.species.nomadent.name: Nomadent
cobblemon.species.nomadent.desc: Leaving its stump house behind, Nomadent has packed its belongings and taken to the road. They prefer to travel at night, sleeping inside tree hollows during the day.
cobblemon.species.agog.name: Agog
cobblemon.species.agog.desc: Agog are kindhearted, often grouping together to protect vulnerable forest areas. It's said if you burn an Agog, accidentally or deliberately, the devil appears.
cobblemon.species.demagog.name: Demagog
cobblemon.species.demagog.desc: When set alight, usually by candles placed in its mouth, Agog evolve, becoming wrathful in the process. Demagog rule over forests by exploiting the fears and insecurities of its inhabitants.
cobblemon.species.morbod.name: Morbod
cobblemon.species.morbod.desc: Its glowing eyes and aloof personality startle many that stumble upon it, allowing it to avoid capture. Cryptozoologists suspect that Morbod play a significant part in local folktales, with their eerie cries resembling crying babies.
cobblemon.species.bodmeast.name: Bodmeast
cobblemon.species.bodmeast.desc: The subject of many local legends, these evasive creatures have become known as the Beasts of Tonbury. No official records of Bodmeast exist, only blurry photographs, pawprints, and the occasional clump of its sharp, wiry fur.
cobblemon.species.willowanne.name: Willowanne
cobblemon.species.willowanne.desc: Willowanne languidly stroll through fields on sunny days, hoping their dry skin catches alight in a spectacular show of fire.
cobblemon.species.altarock.name: Altarock
cobblemon.species.altarock.desc: Altarock are peaceful, sociable creatures that love to be useful. What many believe to be a mouth is actually a hollow, druids were said to place candles inside their mouths when praying.
cobblemon.species.caltarcite.name: Caltarcite
cobblemon.species.caltarcite.desc: Despite a natural hatred of water, Caltarcite are often found around ceremonial baths. Their flat heads are perfect for placing candles and other ritualistic items on.
cobblemon.species.theragong.name: Theragong
cobblemon.species.theragong.desc: Theragong emit calming vibrations from their metal disc. They're popular among complementary therapists, practitioners of alternative medicine and ASMR fanatics alike.
cobblemon.species.scaldrip.name: Scaldrip
cobblemon.species.scaldrip.desc: Scaldrip are feisty and unpredictable, often transforming the landscape of their habitat by blasting a combination of blistering water and jagged rocks at the walls of their caves. Spas will often employ Scaldrip to regulate the humidity of their steam rooms.
cobblemon.species.dousear.name: Dousear
cobblemon.species.dousear.desc: Absorbing water through their porous scales, Dousear keep the environment around them heavily misted. All that pass through its mist cite the soothing effect it has.
cobblemon.species.geyseror.name: Geyseror
cobblemon.species.geyseror.desc: Each Geyseror has a unique hissing sound as it emits steam. Despite its fearsome appearance, locals are fond of these 'singing' Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.mellowick.name: Mellowick
cobblemon.species.mellowick.desc: Mellowick's burning wax body emits the most divine scent, which changes depending on its mood. Candlemakers from all over the world have tried to reproduce these scents, with little success. Lonavan artisans know the secret, but refuse to share the formula, only ever bringing it out for specific occasions.
cobblemon.species.rewaxation.name: Rewaxation
cobblemon.species.rewaxation.desc: The smell of a Rewaxation is usually the first thing any tourist will experience when they first step into Lonava. They have a good-natured disposition, but aren't afraid to defend themselves should any mons attracted by their scent get a bit too close.
cobblemon.species.foreminn.name: Foreminn
cobblemon.species.foreminn.desc: Foreminn are only found deep underground in very specific bodies of water, far from the ocean. It's believed they swim for miles through complex cave systems in search of a particular plant.
cobblemon.species.finpact.name: Finpact
cobblemon.species.finpact.desc: Finpact use their incredibly hard heads to break through rocks in search of their favourite plants. Folklore suggest they were shaped out of mud and then animated by a mystical being.
cobblemon.species.boongus.name: Boongus
cobblemon.species.boongus.desc: Though it appears to be a ghost, Boongus is actually a mushroom. The 'eyes' on its cap are coagulated poison, it's strongly advised not to touch them.
cobblemon.species.oogashroomga.name: Oogashroomga
cobblemon.species.oogashroomga.desc: Trying to look underneath Oogashroomga's cap is a sure-fire way to get yourself hurt. It lumbers and throws its tendrils around to scare off predators.
cobblemon.species.dragimo.name: Dragimo
cobblemon.species.dragimo.desc: To avoid being eaten, these tiny creatures huddle tightly to form a 'carpet', disguising themselves as moss. Their spongy backs can absorb the weight of a human with ease.
cobblemon.species.sphagern.name: Sphagern
cobblemon.species.sphagern.desc: Gaining size during evolution, the now more conspicuous Sphagern set off alone. When frightened or tired, they can blend into the surrounding landscape, appearing to be a mossy hummock.
cobblemon.species.humpeat.name: Humpeat
cobblemon.species.humpeat.desc: Despite being the largest non-legendary Pokemon native to Lonava, Humpeat are extremely difficult to find. Their ability to blend into the surrounding landscape is truly astonishing, gaining them the nickname of 'moving mountain range'.
cobblemon.species.moortaur.name: Moortaur
cobblemon.species.moortaur.desc: These cumbersome and strong Pokemon roam the moors of Lonava. Their stubborn disposition has made their species impossible to domesticate.
cobblemon.species.bluboon.name: Bluboon
cobblemon.species.bluboon.desc: Bluboon move through water by condensing the air in their inflatable sac. Their tentacles are ice cold, allowing Bluboon to easily stun anything passing by.
cobblemon.species.tentaclubble.name: Tentaclubble
cobblemon.species.tentaclubble.desc: Locals are warned to leave wandering Tentaclubble alone. Even brushing by their razor-tipped tentacles is known to cause severe frostbite.
cobblemon.species.shrewphin.name: Dolphin1
cobblemon.species.dolpride.name: Dolphin2
cobblemon.species.chalker.name: Chalker
cobblemon.species.chalker.desc: It uses its limestone-rich claws to mark its territory on cliffs and cave walls. A large hill figure of this creature has been dated back centuries.
cobblemon.species.terrapir.name: Terrapir
cobblemon.species.terrapir.desc: These sturdy Pokemon sleep in the day and roam the forests and hills of Lonava at night. Despite their placid demeanour and appearance, they can pack a nasty bite if disturbed or threatened.
cobblemon.species.chooft.name: Chooft
cobblemon.species.chooft.desc: Chooft are docile Pokemon, and choose to spend most of their days asleep in a field or grazing. If mishandled, they may spit or refuse to move.
cobblemon.species.alpacurrent.name: Alpacurrent
cobblemon.species.alpacurrent.desc: These intelligent Pokemon travel predominantly in herds, and are revered for their luxurious wool. Its high conductivity means that Alpacurrent attract lightning more than most Electric type Pokemon. As a consequence, it can't be kept in a barn.
cobblemon.species.whud.name: Whud
cobblemon.species.whud.desc: Whud are often found bathing in rivers and dirty puddles to keep their naturally dry bodies moist. They slam their heavy bodies against walls and obstacles to startle opponents.
cobblemon.species.pussour.name: Pussour
cobblemon.species.pussour.desc: Upon evolution their formally saturated bodies turn rock hard, increasing their weight substantially. Their appearance and unpleasant demeanour leave many upset, so it takes an incredibly brave trainer to commit to raising one.
cobblemon.species.dimwraith.name: Dimwraith
cobblemon.species.dimwraith.desc: Originally discovered in faraway Mystis, this regional variant lingers around farms, suppressing the growth of crops. A common Lonavan 'saying goes worry not about your bountiful harvests, or risk attracting the Dimwraith.'
cobblemon.species.grainghoul.name: Grainghoul
cobblemon.species.grainghoul.desc: Lonavan farmers live in fear of this creature. Its long black tongue can make an entire field inhospitable in minutes, and it has a nasty habit of lighting itself ablaze, torching every crop in its periphery.
cobblemon.species.ammutt.name: Ammutt
cobblemon.species.ammutt.desc: As Ammutt grow in age and size, their drooping puppy fat fills out and they gain greater stability.
cobblemon.species.pointriever.name: Pointriever
cobblemon.species.pointriever.desc: Pointriever are the ideal partner in every way. Their loyalty to their trainer is famous, and people from all across the world spend thousands to purchase a purebred Lonavan Pointriever.
cobblemon.species.balloonga.name: Balloonga
cobblemon.species.balloonga.desc: Their balloons consist of an elastic film made from ice and filled with internally-converted helium. As a result, Balloonga can fly!
cobblemon.species.aeroluga.name: Aeroluga
cobblemon.species.aeroluga.desc: The combination of Aeroluga's sharp horn and propeller tail help it to tear through the sky at the speed of a plane, for this reason no flights are allowed over the Lonavan mainland.
cobblemon.species.gobbeel.name: Gobbeel
cobblemon.species.gobbeel.desc: Gobbeel are found in every waterway in Lonava, though their natural ability to change colours will make it a much harder task to actually acquire one.
cobblemon.species.inviseel.name: Inviseel
cobblemon.species.inviseel.desc: Inviseel take their pre-evolution's characteristic colour-changing abilities one step further by actually turning invisible when threatened. Limnologists aren't sure exactly where Inviseel can be found, though it's suspected that they could live anywhere.
cobblemon.species.auroreal.name: Auroreal
cobblemon.species.auroreal.desc: Now too large to travel through waterways, Auroreal move to the ocean, lakes, and reservoirs. Their radiant energy and powerful jaws make them a truly powerful ally to have, though getting an Inviseel to evolve is no small task.
cobblemon.species.caprihorn.name: Caprihorn
cobblemon.species.caprihorn.desc: Caprihorn are commonly spotted on Lonavan family crests, albeit a heavily romanticised version, given that a Caprihorn hasn't been sighted in centuries. It's believed this creature is extinct, though many have faked sightings for attention.
cobblemon.species.leilyne.name: Leilyne
cobblemon.species.leilyne.desc: Leilyne's existence can't be scientifically proven, so a sighting often brings with it extensive media attention. They're rumoured to travel via invisible channels connecting sites of historical importance.
cobblemon.species.eldorchard.name: Eldorchard
cobblemon.species.eldorchard.desc: Said to be the spirit of the oldest tree in an apple orchard, local farmers pay tribute to Eldorchard on winter's eve by offering up their last mug of mulled cider. If this Pokemon ever perishes, its entire orchard will perish too.
cobblemon.species.enchantice.name: Enchantice
cobblemon.species.enchantice.desc: Enchantice guard sacred wells, disguising themselves as lids covering the entrance. They wrap their vines around opponents, enchanting them in the process.
cobblemon.species.mossowl.name: Mossowl
cobblemon.species.mossowl.desc: Wandering the planet for centuries, the pelt of a Mossowl is a small insight into their travels. Different flowers and herbs grow within the moss depending on where they have been.
cobblemon.species.faeleaf.name: Faeleaf
cobblemon.species.faeleaf.desc: Faeleaf can fly by rotating their ears. Upon reaching a great height, Faeleaf then drift slowly downwards in a motion akin to dancing. Seeing one means that Autumn's arrival is imminent.
cobblemon.species.aetumnal.name: Aetumnal
cobblemon.species.aetumnal.desc: A sighting of this Mythical Pokemon heralds the end of Autumn and the coming of Winter. Lonavan folklore refers to it as the Harvest Prince, with local farmers often waiting until a sighting before reaping their crops.
cobblemon.species.llampas.name: Llampas
cobblemon.species.llampas.desc: Llampas are cheerful Pokemon with carefree attitudes, which makes them a common choice for new trainers. Although, the Pollen from their fur is especially strong, causing anyone nearby to sneeze violently.
cobblemon.species.danfluff.name: Danfluff
cobblemon.species.danfluff.desc: Danfluff aren't particularly bright, but they are devoted to their trainer. With a single command, they can spread out thousands of pollen spores with one swipe of their tail, causing entire Pollen Storms all on their own.
cobblemon.species.alfalphalops.name: Alfalphalops
cobblemon.species.alfalphalops.desc: The rocky hump on the back of an Alfalphalops can hold nearly a hundred of gallons of water. These special humps allow both them and their lucky trainers to endure even the most extreme of weather conditions.
cobblemon.species.therpal.name: Therpal
cobblemon.species.therpal.desc: The fluid visible in a Therpal's chest is a heated mixture of gases and oil. This allows them to travel at incredible speeds for short bursts, but due to their small size, they have to make frequent stops to make sure they don't run dry.
cobblemon.species.aspfault.name: Aspfault
cobblemon.species.aspfault.desc: Aspfault are highly social creatures. They often use their high body heat to drill through solid rock and stone, creating large tunnel networks inhabited by scores of Therpal and Asfault.
cobblemon.species.tarmendoa.name: Tarmendoa
cobblemon.species.tarmendoa.desc: Tarmendoa's glowing underside and breakneck speeds cause it look like little more than a blur of flame at night. Children often make wishes when they seem them, mistaking a Tarmendoa for a shooting star.
cobblemon.species.burbwhirl.name: Burbwhirl
cobblemon.species.burbwhirl.desc: A Burbwhirl's bubble can be used as a gauge for their emotions. Normally their bubble is rather small, but when they're out exploring the world, their bubble will expand with child-like wonder. However, if a Burbwhirl is frightened, its bubble will pop.
cobblemon.species.spoutlaw.name: Spoutlaw
cobblemon.species.spoutlaw.desc: When in battle, Spoutlaw will motionlessly stare down their opponent, hands hovering over the water pouches on their hips. At the slightest noise, Spoutlaw will lash out and shoot water from its pouches at blinding speeds.
cobblemon.species.vaquamael.name: Vaquamael
cobblemon.species.vaquamael.desc: Vaquamael are natural leaders and are often seen protecting other Pokemon. When someone is out causing trouble, a Vaquamael will rush to catch them using its powerful water lasso.
cobblemon.species.chewmunk.name: Chewmunk
cobblemon.species.chewmunk.desc: Chewmunk are prolific enough to have established a firm population in Kaskade's cities. Their friendly attitude towards people is a trait of a desirable pet, but their need to constantly shave their teeth by chewing makes them difficult pets.
cobblemon.species.cheekat.name: Cheekat
cobblemon.species.cheekat.desc: Cheekat isn't able evolve in the wild, so it's thought that they chose a feline form to be better suited for humans. This seems to have worked, as Cheekat are often used for their hypnotic abilities by those with insomnia.
cobblemon.species.specoey.name: Specoey
cobblemon.species.specoey.desc: Specoey are trained in acting from a young age. Due to this lifelong ability, they often partake in stage plays alongside young children. In some cases, the audience is unable to tell the difference.
cobblemon.species.opakespiel.name: Opakespiel
cobblemon.species.opakespiel.desc: Opakespiel are known for their constant ramblings and monologuing. But when the situation calls for it, an Opakespiel can stop its pulse and play dead for up to a month at a time.
cobblemon.species.kwaile.name: Kwaile
cobblemon.species.kwaile.desc: Scared of everything and often abandoned by their parents, young Kwaile will band together in militant groups. These groups often hunt young Sighlo and Sewaddle to showcase their superiority, but it rarely ever goes their way.
cobblemon.species.quailert.name: Quailert
cobblemon.species.quailert.desc: The need to protect its young is always on its mind. It digs holes and then covers Kwaile with its large wings.
cobblemon.species.quailstion.name: Quailstion
cobblemon.species.quailstion.desc: Its wings are caked with dirt and mud. When it comes to the ground, they combine their wings with the earth below them, creating a very strong barrier.
cobblemon.species.sighlo.name: Sighlo
cobblemon.species.sighlo.desc: It does almost nothing aside from sitting and eating all day. Easily eating its body weight in a sitting. It lets out an occasional sigh from loneliness.
cobblemon.species.cooreds.name: Cooreds
cobblemon.species.cooreds.desc: Like its previous evolution, it is pretty immobile. While waiting to evolve again, it practices making noises with its trumpet-like mouth.
cobblemon.species.probaska.name: Probaska
cobblemon.species.probaska.desc: After evolution, Probaska becomes upbeat and energetic. They are known to have large parties in some forests at night.
cobblemon.species.histameanie.name: Histameanie
cobblemon.species.histameanie.desc: Histameanie are infamous for hiding in tall grass and attacking unsuspecting passerby. Due to this, it is uncommon to see a trainer in Kaskade without a repel.
cobblemon.species.apheed.name: Apheed
cobblemon.species.apheed.desc: Apheed like to eat fruits and other plants together in a large swarm from the inside out. In the summer, berry farmers are very wary of Apheed.
cobblemon.species.musleafo.name: Musleafo
cobblemon.species.musleafo.desc: Musleafo are most common in the spring and summer, always on the hunt for more and more sweet nectar. They like to hunt together, although loners are not unheard of.
cobblemon.species.eecroach.name: Eecroach
cobblemon.species.eecroach.desc: Eeroach like to go in cities and disguise themselves as weeds in between sidewalks, they look for any sugary foods Pokemon or Humans leave behind.
cobblemon.species.swarm_eecroach.name: Eecroach
cobblemon.species.clamtrip.name: Clamtrip
cobblemon.species.clamtrip.desc: Being attracted to shiny objects, Clamtrip often fight among themselves, trying to steal the others pearls. Clamperl are their favorite prey.
cobblemon.species.rowviar.name: Rowviar
cobblemon.species.rowviar.desc: These small Pokemon travel in schools of 12 and tend to swim in a V formation. When one evolves into Sanook, they leave their colony to start a new one.
cobblemon.species.sanook.name: Sanook
cobblemon.species.sanook.desc: Sanook have immensely strong jaws that rival Pokemon such as Drednaw. Their beaks grow sharper with age, making elder Sanook the most powerful in their colony.
cobblemon.species.tofrug.name: Tofrug
cobblemon.species.kaskazog.name: Kaskazog
cobblemon.species.ananot.name: Ananot
cobblemon.species.ananot.desc: Ananots have a sticky mucus that smells like that of ripe Nanab berries. Although this mucus is inherently toxic, when properly processed they can be used for medicinal purposes.
cobblemon.species.ananoop.name: Ananoop
cobblemon.species.ananoop.desc: Ananoop are commonly mistaken for ripe fruit by tourists, though if touched have a gooey toxin so powerful it could cause temporary paralysis lasting several hours.
cobblemon.species.mosster.name: Mosster
cobblemon.species.mosster.desc: Mosster like to lay on roofs, using its fur to plant itself between the shingles. Large colonies of Mosster can form if not checked regularly.
cobblemon.species.mosskrat.name: Mosskrat
cobblemon.species.mosskrat.desc: Mosskrat run around in small packs, they choose the leader by who has the longest tail, although some packs follow alternate colored Mosskrat.
cobblemon.species.catteraxe.name: Catteraxe
cobblemon.species.catteraxe.desc: Catteraxe swing their axe like tail to clear anything in it's path. They are wild and uncontrollable pokemon, although many older women have a fondness for it.
cobblemon.species.catatomb.name: Catatomb
cobblemon.species.enigmeon.name: Enigmeon
cobblemon.species.enigmeon.desc: The origins of this Pokemon remain shrouded in mystery. While it evolves from the use of a Mist Stone, there is no record of Enigmeon existing at any point in the past.
cobblemon.species.desoray.name: Desoray
cobblemon.species.desoray.desc: With their whip like tail, they can attack with intense speed and power. They like to hide in the sand, using it as camouflage to catch their prey.
cobblemon.species.pudet.name: Pudet
cobblemon.species.pudet.desc: Pudet are very friendly pokemon, commonly kept as family pets. They will not hesitate to protect the ones it loves, even if it isn't strong enough to handle many threats.
cobblemon.species.woond.name: Woond
cobblemon.species.woond.desc: Back before the current era, a group of Woond saved many Kaskadian, Alolan, and Unovian soldiers in the Continental War. They are known for their bravery and intense perseverance.
cobblemon.species.pramblo.name: Pramblo
cobblemon.species.pramblo.desc: This Pokemon has a tube of hot glass coming off of its protective shell. This tube is formed from the glass leftover after the shell’s formation. Pramblo use it to interact with the outside world.
cobblemon.species.glashulimp.name: Glashulimp
cobblemon.species.drout.name: Drout
cobblemon.species.drout.desc: Drout is regarded as an ancestor to Sanook, although scientists are unsure of how both pokemon can co-exist in the same time period. They have weak lungs but choose to breathe through their gills.
cobblemon.species.dry_drout.name: Drout
cobblemon.species.guruchi.name: Guruchi
cobblemon.species.guruchi.desc: Guruchi have turbine-like tails which they use to process and condense water. This processed water can be shot at incredibly fast rates through the gap between its teeth, allowing Guruchi to cut wood with ease.
cobblemon.species.porygonomega.name: Porygon-Omega
cobblemon.species.estoe.name: Estoe
cobblemon.species.estoe.desc: Some say this Pokemon originated from another plane of existence. Lingering in its presence is considered dangerous due to the strange, cell altering energy it emits.
cobblemon.species.perpetua.name: Perpetua
cobblemon.species.perpetua.desc: As mysterious as Perpetua is, several high influencing leaders in history have shown odd favoritism for this Pokemon. It can emit a strange light from its frills.
cobblemon.species.tooburm.name: Tooburm
cobblemon.species.tooburm.desc: Tooburm are rarely seen above ground, choosing to eat potatoes and stay hidden. They have very weak electric type attacks that are launched from their prongs.
cobblemon.species.detrarc.name: Detrarc
cobblemon.species.detrarc.desc: The potato around Detrarc's neck is mature enough to appear to be fully grown. Farmers sometimes grab Detrarc up and get shocked as a result of it.
cobblemon.species.qayagus.name: Qayagus
cobblemon.species.auditaur.name: Auditaur
cobblemon.species.auditaur.desc: It's said that if an Auditaur begins to sing while you pet it, you'll receive many years of good luck. Its voice is very soft and used to calm small children down.
cobblemon.species.oxillery.name: Oxillery
cobblemon.species.oxillery.desc: Oxillery are among the loudest Pokemon ever recorded, although they prefer to replicate the noises they hear through their sensitive horns.
cobblemon.species.mienflux.name: Mienflux
cobblemon.species.gneckle.name: Gneckle
cobblemon.species.gneckle.desc: Gneckle are too weak to completely leave their shell, leaving them in a mostly immobile state. Female Rabyoose will do anything to protect a newborn Gneckle.
cobblemon.species.rabyoose.name: Rabyoose
cobblemon.species.rabyoose.desc: Most wild Rabyoose have no interest in humans or other Pokemon, making them hostile to anyone not of their kind. Rabyoose are known to aggressively charge at others in their pack to assert dominance.
cobblemon.species.tamroast.name: Tamroast
cobblemon.species.vitisquash.name: Vitisquash
cobblemon.species.vitisquash.desc: Vitisquash use their large feet to squish grapes it grows with fellow farmers. No one knows where they came from, just that they are gentle souls.
cobblemon.species.dionysseur.name: Dionysseur
cobblemon.species.umbralu.name: Umbralu
cobblemon.species.umbralu.desc: Umbralu have a dark aura in their underskirt that is pitch black and impossible to see through. Strong Unbralu can concentrate this energy to shoot beams of darkness that leach the opponent’s life force.
cobblemon.species.nomobjeka.name: Nomobjeka
cobblemon.species.nomobjeka.desc: The existence of Nomobjeka, a fun-loving guardian Pokemon, was just recently proven. It goes out in search of fainted wild Pokemon and guards them until they recover. These Pokemon can only be found in hidden areas shrouded by foliage, making them a rare sight in the wild.
cobblemon.species.kleptarak.name: Kleptarak
cobblemon.species.kleptarak.desc: These menacing Pokemon use their long legs and hand-like tail to rapidly climb in ways that defy gravity. Kleptarak are notorious for stalking their prey at night and snatching them into the shadows.
cobblemon.species.kituff.name: Kituff
cobblemon.species.beadamup.name: Beadamup
cobblemon.species.rascoom.name: Rascoom
cobblemon.species.faebril.name: Faebril
cobblemon.species.faebril.desc: By touching a pokemon or human with their wings, they can send healing pulses through them. They also are very strong defibrillator, even being able to start the heart of Wailord.
cobblemon.species.botnyak.name: Botnyak
cobblemon.species.botnyak.desc: Originally created by Tom Bezzle as a companion Pokemon, Botnyak were engineered to be extremely marketable. When the product flopped, Botnyak were repurposed by Amaze-All for other projects.
cobblemon.species.vendrom.name: Vendrom
cobblemon.species.buwuve.name: Buwuve
cobblemon.species.wasgrowl.name: Wasgrowl
cobblemon.species.worcane.name: Worcane
cobblemon.species.worcane.desc: This Pokemon is notoriously hard to train, but very rewarding when done right. Worcane are the alpha of the ocean, leading Pokemon on their team to victory.
cobblemon.species.probat.name: Probat
cobblemon.species.jemineye.name: Jemineye
cobblemon.species.jemineye.desc: Under the water, nothing is more aware than Jemineye. It always sees through its gem like eyes, even while it rests, it always is ready to escape.
cobblemon.species.oracub.name: Oracub
cobblemon.species.bearvoyance.name: Bearvoyance
cobblemon.species.bearvoyance.desc: Bearvoyance can use their psychic abilities to wisely predict their foe’s next move. Elder Bearvoyance love to work at daycares, giving words of wisdom to Pokemon while they’re still in eggs.
cobblemon.species.folleming.name: Folleming
cobblemon.species.folleming.desc: Follemings are mind controlled by the leader Folleming to do things against their will. When a Folleming is strong enough to resist the leader’s mental commands, they will overthrow the current leader.
cobblemon.species.drosabell.name: Drosabell
cobblemon.species.drosabell.desc: Kaskadian Bellsprout who study on Spectoul Mountain awaken their true psychic abilities, evolving into Drosabell. They can force their presence into any creatures mind, normally using this ability to eat any weak pokemon around.
cobblemon.species.yanmage.name: Yanmage
cobblemon.species.bloomage.name: Bloomage
cobblemon.species.bloomage.desc: Shooting fireballs everywhere, they are known for causing trouble and chaos wherever they run to.
cobblemon.species.obsidious.name: Obsidious
cobblemon.species.mercryni.name: Mercryni
cobblemon.species.mercryni.desc: When startled, Mercryni cry tears of mercury. Its sharp spikes are corroded and rusty. Touching the spikes or tears of a Mercryni may result in hospitalization.
cobblemon.species.meraculisk.name: Meraculisk
cobblemon.species.meraculisk.desc: This Pokemon has gone under rigorous training to overcome even it's darkest fears and has mastered the manipulation of it's poison.
cobblemon.species.golgre.name: Golgre
cobblemon.species.prospectre.name: Prospectre
cobblemon.species.skideer.name: Skideer
cobblemon.species.yuleigh.name: Yuleigh
cobblemon.species.feafurr.name: Feafurr
cobblemon.species.feafurr.desc: Feafurr haven’t mastered the ability to control their fire based abilities, putting their bodies in an imbalanced limbo. Although they seem cowardly, Feafurr will always try their best.
cobblemon.species.vaicear.name: Vaicear
cobblemon.species.vaicear.desc: With a new found homeostasis, Vaicear have mastered the balance between fire and ice. This apex Pokemon once used their heated claws to traverse through the frigid arctic.
cobblemon.species.phisnooz.name: Phisnooz
cobblemon.species.phisnooz.desc: By waving their trunk, Phisnooz emit psychic waves that can put people to sleep in mere seconds. In a previous time they were the prey of Vaicear.
cobblemon.species.telemac.name: Telemac
cobblemon.species.telemac.desc: Telemac can speak telepathically with other Telemac, allowing them to call others when under attack by a pack of Vaicear. When in battle, Telemac use this ability to confuse other Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.macedontus.name: Macedontus
cobblemon.species.macedontus.desc: As an ancestor to Sandshrew, a Macedontus can resist even the strongest attacks. Using their spiky tail, Macedontus can crush foes while defending itself.
cobblemon.species.crynorawst.name: Crynorawst
cobblemon.species.crynorawst.desc: Crynorawst are selfless, thinking only of others in a time of need. In Kaskadian mythology, a herd of Crynorawst were said to have moved mountains using their impressive horns.
cobblemon.species.rotomb.name: Rotomb
cobblemon.species.tamunk.name: Tamunk
